results.title: Safety in the home. - 3rd ed.
results.creator_credit: H William Varney, Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates through a series of brief incidents, the importance of making common sense “decisions of safety” to prevent household mishaps. Includes test situations for children to make correct choices.
results.creator_credit_for_label: H William Varney, Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Safety in the home. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the most common safety hazards in the home and how they can be corrected. The film is centred round the story of how a child’s negligence in putting away her toys causes an accident which injures her mother. The incident leads to a thorough check of the household and the removal of other danger spots.

results.title: Safety in the chemistry laboratory
results.brief_description: Professional chemists are shown using safe practices in handling the tools of their trade in the research laboratory. Safety practices are recommended for use in the high school chemistry laboratory. Recommended for schools.

results.title: Safety in offices
results.creator_credit: Bureau of Aeronautics and United States. Navy
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of some of the more common accidents that happen in offices - stumbling over open file drawers, catching fingers in drawers, tipping chairs over backwards, etc. These accidents are presented in a humorous manner but the serious consequences of carelessness are stressed.

results.brief_description: Shows the correct and safe way in which to use common household appliance such as a penknife, stepladder, electrical apparatus, gas ovens, etc.

results.title: Safety and Survival
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Safe in the water
results.brief_description: Water should be fun and if the rules are observed you can be safe in the water. Dramatised episodes show the most frequent causes of water accidents involving children. Details precautions that should be taken, and rescue techniques. Emphasises the importance of learning to swim at an early age. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description: Water should be fun and if the rules are observed you can be safe in the water. Dramatised episodes show the most frequent causes of water accidents involving children. results.title: Safe in the snow
results.creator_credit: Eric Fullilove, British Petroleum and Cinesound
results.brief_description: The ski rescue service is made up of volunteers, well-trained in search and rescue, first aid and transportation of the injured. Shows the work of the safety patrols in the winter, and sports centres in New South Wales and Victoria. Stresses the need for suitable clothing, well made skis and adequate care when skiing.

results.title: Safe in nature
results.brief_description: Dramatizes two examples of young people getting lost in the woods and in the desert, pointing out what the people did wrong while lost and what they should have done. Information is given on conserving energy and body moisture as well as many other aspects of bushcraft for survival

results.title: Safe for life (E)
results.creator_credit: Liller Moller, Svend Johansen, Denmark. National Board of Health and Filmforsyningen
results.brief_description: The AIDS epidemic is one which affects both the heterosexual and homosexual community - and being young isn’t a guarantee of immunity, in fact the young are probably one of the most vulnerable groups. Using clever animation, this production broaches the topic of AIDS prevention through the careful use of the condom, the only known way of avoiding the disease. WARNING: THE MATERIAL IS VISUALLY EXPLICIT.
